Korean Judoists Prove Successful 
    Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK women judoists won a gold medal and two silver medals at the 2005 Asia Judo Championships in Tashkent, Uzbekistan, on May 14 and 15.
 An Kum Ae placed first in the 52 kg category, while Kim Myong Ok came second in the 48 kg category and Kim Ryon Mi in the 78 kg category.

articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Eritrean President
    Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Issaias Afewerki, president of Eritrea, on the occasion of its 14th national day.
 Wishing the Eritrean president and people greater success in the work to build a developed and prosperous, new society, the message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in their mutual interests.

articles.title: Korean Cameramen's Union Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Czech Speaker of Chamber of Deputies
    Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with Lubomir Zaoralek, speaker of the Chamber of Deputies of the Czech Republic who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
 On hand were Vice-Chairman of the SPA Kang Nung Su, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and officials concerned and Deputy Speaker of
the Chamber of Deputies Ivan Langer and deputies, and Czech Charge d'Affaires here Miroslav Podhajsky and others.
